sentences.english: Firecrackers exploded, flags flew high, and cars honked wildly.
sentences.chinese: 炮聲陣陣，旗幟飛揚，就連汽車的喇叭都摁得朝天響。

sentences.english: He waited until he heard shots. Then he peered through the skylight, into the darkened tavern.
sentences.chinese: 他等到槍聲響起，才透過天窗朝陰暗的酒館內看去。

sentences.english: The dentist gave my tooth a blast to dry the filling.
sentences.chinese: 牙醫朝我的牙吹風使補牙材料乾結。

sentences.english: More guards, carrying six wooden coffins, made their way to a wall on the prison's seaward side.
sentences.chinese: 又有幾個守衛扛着六具棺木朝監獄靠海的一面牆走去。

sentences.english: The peasant led us down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 那個農民帶我們朝山下走。

sentences.english: His mommy was headed toward the clothesline with a basket of wet clothes.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽提着一籃子溼衣服，朝晾衣繩這邊走來。

sentences.english: The Chinese Communist Party and government attach great importance to China-DPRK ties.
sentences.chinese: 中國黨和政府高度重視中朝關係。

sentences.english: I inched my way toward the door and heard it again.
sentences.chinese: 我躡手躡腳的朝屋門走過去，這個聲音又發出了一次。

sentences.english: The car sped along the road towards the village.
sentences.chinese: 汽車沿公路朝那村子疾駛而去。

sentences.english: Huge waves came crashing almost on top of us.

sentences.chinese: 卡布又朝女孩走近了一步。

sentences.english: Well, it's the direction that's perpendicular to this plane.
sentences.chinese: 它其實是朝垂直於平面的方向。

sentences.english: Absorbed in their play, they don’t notice the train coming down the track towards them.
sentences.chinese: 他們玩得很投入，沒有注意到朝他們衝過來的火車。

sentences.english: But "fewer than a dozen people" are looking in this direction, she said.
sentences.chinese: 但是朝這個方向研究的人寥寥無幾，她說。

sentences.english: Rootless things fly through the air toward her and land at her feet.
sentences.chinese: 空中的飛行物都會朝她飛來，落在她的腳邊。

sentences.english: Dick found himself walking in the direction of the church.
sentences.chinese: 迪克發現自己不知不覺朝教堂方向走去。

facing forwards
to walk over (to)
directly
to turn one's head/to turn around
to charge into
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
to pout/to stick out one's lips
nutation (plants turning to face the sun)
to turn one's head/to change direction/U-turn/volte face/to repent
to turn around
to get up/to leave/to set forth
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to reassign sb to a different job/to turn around/to change direction/to make a U turn
out/outbound/departing
large strides
to wave (one's hand)
